channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: New York Governor Andrew Cuomo resigns in wake of harassment report
item.description: The Democrat says he will step aside after an inquiry found he sexually harassed multiple women.

item.title: Ethiopia PM Abiy Ahmed calls on civilians to join Tigray war
item.description: Abiy Ahmed has asked all "capable" Ethiopians to join the fight against resurgent Tigrayan rebels.

item.title: Lithuania to build fence on Belarus border to stop migrants
item.description: Tensions are running high with Belarus after a surge of non-EU migrants into Lithuania.

item.title: Princess Latifa: Campaign to free Dubai ruler's daughter disbanded
item.description: The Dubai ruler's daughter was pictured in Iceland after accusing her father of keeping her captive.

item.title: Greece fires: Foreign teams join battle on Evia island
item.description: Several European countries are helping Greece to tackle the blazes ravaging parched forests.

item.title: Florida governor says no salaries for school leaders requiring masks
item.description: As cases rise across the US, Florida's governor argues school mask rules infringe on parent rights.

item.title: Anger as Nigerian diplomat manhandled in Indonesia
item.description: Nigeria says there was "no justification" for an official's mistreatment by immigration officers.

item.title: North Korea leaves hotline with South unanswered during military drills
item.description: Tensions have risen in the Korean peninsula as South Korea and the US hold joint military drills.

item.title: Infrastructure bill: $1tn for clean energy, internet, trains and more
item.description: The $1tn bill takes aim at issues from buckling bridges to global warming and remote working.

item.title: I Am Legend screenwriter dismisses anti-vax claims based on film's plot
item.description: A sci-fi writer hits back at unfounded rumours that Covid jabs turn people into zombies.

item.title: Odeon owner AMC to accept payment in Bitcoin
item.description: Cinemagoers will be able to buy tickets and popcorn using the cryptocurrency, says the US chain.

item.title: Olivia Podmore: New Zealand Olympic cyclist dies aged 24
item.description: New Zealand Olympic cyclist Olivia Podmore dies at the age of 24, Cycling New Zealand announces.

item.title: Biden's unlikely plan to use roads to fight racism
item.description: An infrastructure package that seeks to address inequality gets a mixed reception on the ground.

item.title: Olympic medals: An alternative table - with US 15th
item.description: How would the medals table look if population and wealth were taken into account?

item.title: Afghanistan: Why is there a war?
item.description: As foreign forces pull out after 20 years of war, what did it achieve and what happens next?

item.title: Why South Korean women are reclaiming their short hair
item.description: Thousands proudly show off their short hair after an Olympic athlete is criticised for her haircut.

item.title: Climate change: Five things we have learned from the IPCC report
item.description: What are the key takeaways from the IPCC new study on the science of climate change?

item.title: Malta: The teenagers pulled from the sea and accused of terrorism
item.description: How three teenagers rescued from the Mediterranean Sea ended up in Malta accused of terrorism.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban seizure will challenge West - Gen Sir Nick Carter
item.description: The chief of the defence staff on difficulties ahead if the Taliban illegitimately seize control.

item.title: Fashion photographer: 'The world doesn't see this part of Afghanistan'
item.description: Fatimah Hossaini is a fashion photographer in Afghanistan and wants to use her work to help women be seen.

item.title: Greece wildfires: 'It's like a horror movie but it's real life'
item.description: Thousands of people have had to evacuate Greece's second biggest island as severe wildfires rage.

item.title: Lukashenko: 'You can choke on your sanctions in the UK'
item.description: The UK and US are tightening sanctions on Belarus, hitting economic sectors.

item.title: Lionel Messi: Barcelona star in tears as he receives ovation news conference
item.description: Lionel Messi is distraught as he receives a standing ovation from team-mates, journalists, officials and his family at a news conference confirming his departure from Barcelona.
